details:
Several vulnerability have been fixed in libsdl2, the older version of
the Simple DirectMedia Layer library that provides low level access to
audio, keyboard, mouse, joystick, and graphics hardware.


* [CVE-2019-7572](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7572)
Buffer over-read in IMA\_ADPCM\_nibble in audio/SDL\_wave.c
* [CVE-2019-7573](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7573)
Heap-based buffer over-read in InitMS\_ADPCM in audio/SDL\_wave.c
* [CVE-2019-7574](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7574)
Heap-based buffer over-read in IMA\_ADPCM\_decode in audio/SDL\_wave.c
* [CVE-2019-7575](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7575)
Heap-based buffer overflow in MS\_ADPCM\_decode in audio/SDL\_wave.c
* [CVE-2019-7576](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7576)
Heap-based buffer over-read in InitMS\_ADPCM in audio/SDL\_wave.c
* [CVE-2019-7577](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7577)
Buffer over-read in SDL\_LoadWAV\_RW in audio/SDL\_wave.c
* [CVE-2019-7578](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7578)
Heap-based buffer over-read in InitIMA\_ADPCM in audio/SDL\_wave.c
* [CVE-2019-7635](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7635)
Heap-based buffer over-read in Blit1to4 in video/SDL\_blit\_1.c
* [CVE-2019-7636](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7636)
Heap-based buffer over-read in SDL\_GetRGB in video/SDL\_pixels.c
* [CVE-2019-7637](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7637)
Heap-based buffer overflow in SDL\_FillRect in video/SDL\_surface.c
* [CVE-2019-7638](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7638)
Heap-based buffer over-read in Map1toN in video/SDL\_pixels.c
* [CVE-2019-13616](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13616)
Heap-based buffer over-read in BlitNtoN in video/SDL\_blit\_N.c


For Debian 9 stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
1.2.15+dfsg1-4+deb9u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your libsdl1.2 packages.


For the detailed security status of libsdl1.2 please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/libsdl1.2>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
